2026-01-27.content:
The BigQuery Data Transfer Service can now
[transfer data from Mailchimp to BigQuery](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/mailchimp-transfer).
This feature is in [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Mailchimp data transfer to BigQuery
summary.summary: You can now transfer data from Mailchimp to BigQuery using the BigQuery Data Transfer Service. This new feature is currently in Preview.

2026-01-26.content:
You can now use Gemini Cloud Assist to
[discover resources](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/use-cloud-assist#discover_resources)
across your projects. For example, you can ask about a specific table's schema,
or which tables contain demographic information about new users. This feature is
in [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Discover resources with Gemini Cloud Assist
summary.summary: Gemini Cloud Assist now allows you to discover resources across your projects. You can ask questions about table schemas or specific data types. This feature is currently in Preview.

2026-01-23.content:
You can now optionally specify which model to use by passing an endpoint
argument to the
[`AI.IF`](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/bigqueryml-syntax-ai-if),
[`AI.SCORE`](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/bigqueryml-syntax-ai-score),
and
[`AI.CLASSIFY`](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/bigqueryml-syntax-ai-classify)
functions.

summary.title: Choose your AI model
summary.summary: You can now specify the exact model you want to use with the AI.IF, AI.SCORE, and AI.CLASSIFY functions by passing an endpoint argument. This provides more control over your AI model selections.

2026-01-22.content:
You can now run queries that use the
[`AI.IF`](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/bigqueryml-syntax-ai-if),
[`AI.SCORE`](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/bigqueryml-syntax-ai-score),
and
[`AI.CLASSIFY`](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/bigqueryml-syntax-ai-classify)
functions by using your
[end-user credentials](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/permissions-for-ai-functions) instead of a
BigQuery connection.

summary.title: New options for AI functions in BigQuery
summary.summary: You can now run queries using AI.IF, AI.SCORE, and AI.CLASSIFY functions with your end-user credentials. This change offers more flexibility in how you interact with these powerful AI capabilities.

2026-01-22.content:
Support for
[table parameters in table-valued functions](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/table-functions#table_parameters)
is restored.

summary.title: Table function table parameters restored
summary.summary: Support for table parameters in table-valued functions has been restored. This fix ensures that table parameters can be correctly used within table functions.

2026-01-21.content:
You can now use Gemini Cloud Assist to
[get information about your job history](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/use-cloud-assist#analyze_jobs),
such as why a particular query was slow or which queries were the most
resource-intensive in the past day. This feature is in
[Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Gemini Cloud Assist: Job History Insights
summary.summary: Gemini Cloud Assist now helps you understand your job history. You can analyze past queries to identify performance bottlenecks and resource usage. This feature is currently in Preview.

2026-01-21.content: BigQuery is now available in the [Bangkok (`asia-southeast3`) region](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/locations#regions).

summary.title: BigQuery now in Bangkok
summary.summary: BigQuery is now available in the Bangkok region (asia-southeast3). This expansion brings BigQuery's powerful data warehousing capabilities closer to customers in Southeast Asia.

2026-01-19.content:
[Dataform workflows](https://docs.cloud.google.com/dataform/docs/sql-workflows),
[BigQuery notebooks](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/orchestrate-notebooks),
[pipelines](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/schedule-pipelines),
and
[data preparations](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/orchestrate-data-preparations)
are enforcing strict act-as mode at the project level. To avoid failures and
maintain automatic releases, you must use custom service accounts instead of the
default Dataform service agent across all repositories. You must also grant the
Service Account User role (`roles/iam.serviceAccountUser`) to the default
Dataform service agent and relevant principals. For more information and to
verify act-as permissions, see
[Use strict act-as mode](https://docs.cloud.google.com/dataform/docs/strict-act-as-mode).

summary.title: Action Required: Update Dataform Service Accounts
summary.summary: Strict act-as mode is now enforced for Dataform workflows, BigQuery notebooks, pipelines, and data preparations at the project level. To prevent failures, update your repositories to use custom service accounts instead of the default Dataform service agent and grant the Service Account User role to the Dataform service agent and other relevant principals.

2026-01-07.content:
You can now use the Google-developed, open source
[Java Database Connectivity (JDBC) driver for BigQuery](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/jdbc-for-bigquery)
to connect your Java applications to BigQuery. This feature is in
[Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: BigQuery JDBC driver for Java now available
summary.summary: Connect your Java applications to BigQuery using the new open-source JDBC driver. This feature is currently in Preview.

2026-01-06.content:
The [`CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE`](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/data-definition-language#create_external_table_statement)
and [`LOAD DATA`](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/load-statements)
statements now support the following options:

* `time_zone`: specify a time zone to use when loading data
* `date_format`, `datetime_format`, `time_format`, and `timestamp_format`: define how date and time values are formatted in your source files
* `null_markers`: define the strings that represent `NULL` values in CSV files.
* `source_column_match`: specify how loaded columns are matched to the schema. You can match columns by position or by name.

These features are [generally
available](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages) (GA).

summary.title: New data loading options for BigQuery
summary.summary: BigQuery's CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE and LOAD DATA statements now support advanced options for handling time zones, date and time formats, null markers, and column matching. These features are now generally available, offering more flexibility and control over your data loading processes.

2025-12-22.content:
The BigQuery Data Transfer Service can now [transfer data from PostgreSQL to
BigQuery](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/postgresql-transfer). This feature is [generally
available](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages) (GA).

summary.title: Transfer PostgreSQL data to BigQuery
summary.summary: You can now transfer data from PostgreSQL to BigQuery. This feature is now generally available.

2025-12-19.content:
The BigQuery Data Transfer Service can now [transfer data from Microsoft SQL
Server to BigQuery](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/sqlserver-transfer). This feature is in
[Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: SQL Server data transfer to BigQuery available
summary.summary: BigQuery Data Transfer Service now supports transferring data from Microsoft SQL Server to BigQuery. This feature is currently in Preview.

2025-12-19.content:
The BigQuery Data Transfer Service can now [transfer data from MySQL to
BigQuery](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/mysql-transfer). This feature is [generally
available](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages) (GA).

summary.title: MySQL data transfer to BigQuery now available
summary.summary: You can now transfer data from MySQL to BigQuery. This feature is generally available.

2025-12-18.content:
You can now use the BigQuery Data Transfer Service [to transfer data from blob
storage sources](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/iceberg-ingestion), such as Amazon Simple
Storage Service (Amazon S3), Azure Blob Storage, and Cloud Storage, into BigLake
Iceberg tables in BigQuery. This feature is in
[Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Data Transfer Service for Iceberg Tables
summary.summary: BigQuery Data Transfer Service now supports transferring data from blob storage sources like Amazon S3 and Azure Blob Storage into BigLake Iceberg tables. This new feature is currently in Preview.

2025-12-18.content:
The BigQuery Data Transfer Service can now transfer data from the following data
sources to BigQuery:

* [Klaviyo](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/klaviyo-transfer)
* [HubSpot](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/hubspot-transfer)

These features are in [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: New Data Sources Available in BigQuery Transfer Service
summary.summary: BigQuery Data Transfer Service now supports data transfers from Klaviyo and HubSpot. These new features are currently in Preview. This allows you to easily move your marketing data into BigQuery for analysis.

2025-12-16.content:
The BigQuery Data Transfer Service can now [transfer data from Oracle to
BigQuery](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/oracle-transfer). This feature is [generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages) (GA).

summary.title: Oracle data transfer to BigQuery
summary.summary: BigQuery Data Transfer Service now supports transferring data from Oracle to BigQuery. This feature is now generally available, allowing for seamless integration.

2025-12-10.content:
You can now use the [BigQuery remote MCP server](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/use-bigquery-mcp)
to enable LLM agents to perform a range of data-related tasks.

This feature is in
[Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: LLM agents can now query BigQuery data
summary.summary: BigQuery remote MCP server is now available in preview, allowing LLM agents to perform various data-related tasks. This new feature enables more advanced data analysis and manipulation directly through AI agents.

2025-12-02.content:
You can now enable
[autonomous embedding generation](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/autonomous-embedding-generation)
on tables that you make with the
[`CREATE TABLE` statement](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/data-definition-language#create_table_statement).
When you do this, BigQuery maintains a column of embeddings on
the table based on a source column. When you add or modify data in the source
column, BigQuery automatically generates or updates the embedding
column for that data.

You can also use the
[`AI.SEARCH`](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/bigqueryml-syntax-ai-search)
function, enabling semantic search on tables that have autonomous embedding
generation enabled.

These features are in
[Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Autonomous Embedding Generation
summary.summary: BigQuery now supports autonomous embedding generation for tables created with the `CREATE TABLE` statement. This feature automatically maintains an embeddings column based on a source column, updating embeddings as data changes. Additionally, the `AI.SEARCH` function enables semantic search on tables with this feature enabled. These capabilities are currently in Preview.

2025-12-02.content:
An updated version of the
[ODBC driver for BigQuery](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/odbc-jdbc-drivers#current_odbc_driver)
is now available.

summary.title: Updated BigQuery ODBC driver released
summary.summary: A new version of the ODBC driver for BigQuery has been released. This update includes the latest improvements and bug fixes for enhanced performance and stability when connecting to BigQuery.

2025-12-01.content:
Search results in the [Explorer
pane](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/bigquery-web-ui#explorer_pane) in BigQuery Studio now show
results in the current organization. You can use a drop-down menu to switch
between organizations. This feature is [generally
available](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages) (GA).

summary.title: Search results now in current organization
summary.summary: Search results in BigQuery Studio now show results in the current organization. You can use a drop-down menu to switch between organizations.

2025-11-26.content:
The BigQuery Data Transfer Service now supports [incremental data transfers](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/salesforce-transfer#full_or_incremental_transfers)
when transferring data from Salesforce to BigQuery. This feature is supported in
[Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Incremental data transfers from Salesforce to BigQuery now in Preview
summary.summary: The BigQuery Data Transfer Service now supports incremental data transfers from Salesforce to BigQuery. This feature is available in Preview.

2025-11-25.content:
An updated version of the
[JDBC driver for BigQuery](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/odbc-jdbc-drivers#current_jdbc_driver)
is now available.

summary.title: New BigQuery JDBC Driver Available
summary.summary: An updated version of the JDBC driver for BigQuery has been released. This new version includes improvements and bug fixes for a better user experience.

2025-11-24.content:
You can
[set the default project and dataset for your pipeline](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/create-pipelines#sqlx-options)
in the **SQLX options** section, which simplifies task configuration by using
these defaults for all tasks. This feature is
[generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages)
(GA).

summary.title: Default Project and Dataset for Pipelines
summary.summary: Set default project and dataset for your pipeline in SQLX options to simplify task configuration. This feature is now generally available.

2025-11-20.content:
You can now use the BigQuery Agent Analytics plugin within the Agent Development
Kit to export agent interaction data directly into BigQuery. This plugin
captures comprehensive logs of your agent's prompts, tool usage, and responses,
enabling you to analyze and visualize agent performance metrics. The plugin
leverages the BigQuery Storage Write API for efficient high-throughput
streaming. For more information on how to leverage this plugin in your agent,
see the
[Announcing BigQuery Agent Analytics for the Google ADK](https://cloud.google.com/blog/products/data-analytics/introducing-bigquery-agent-analytics/?e=48754805).

summary.title: BigQuery Agent Analytics Plugin
summary.summary: Export agent interaction data to BigQuery using the new Agent Analytics plugin in the Agent Development Kit. Analyze performance with comprehensive logs and efficient data streaming.

2025-11-19.content:
You can now use Gemini in BigQuery to
[fix and explain errors](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/write-sql-gemini#fix_and_explain_sql_errors)
in your SQL queries. This feature is in
[Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Gemini in BigQuery Now Available
summary.summary: You can now use Gemini in BigQuery to fix and explain errors in your SQL queries. This feature is in Preview.

2025-11-19.content:
You can use the
[`JSON_FLATTEN` function](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/json_functions#json_flatten)
to extract all non-array values that are either directly in the input `JSON`
value or children of one or more consecutively nested arrays in the input
`JSON` value. This function is available in
[Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: New JSON_FLATTEN function
summary.summary: Extract non-array values from JSON with nested arrays.

2025-11-18.content:
Dataform now lets you automate the creation of
[BigLake tables for Apache Iceberg in BigQuery](https://docs.cloud.google.com/dataform/docs/create-tables#create-iceberg-table).
This feature is
[generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages)
(GA).

summary.title: Dataform now supports Apache Iceberg tables in BigQuery
summary.summary: Dataform now allows you to automate the creation of BigLake tables for Apache Iceberg in BigQuery. This new feature is now generally available.

2025-11-18.content:
BigQuery ML now supports the following
[generative AI functions](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/generative-ai-overview):

* [`AI.GENERATE`](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/bigqueryml-syntax-ai-generate):
  generate free text to accomplish a wide range of tasks, such as
  translation, summarization, and classification, on any unstructured data,
  including images, audio, video, and documents. It can also perform entity
  extraction and generate structured output. This function is
  [generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages)
  (GA).
* [`AI.EMBED`](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/bigqueryml-syntax-ai-embed):
  turn text, image, audio, video, or documents into embeddings. This function
  is in [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages).
* [`AI.SIMILARITY`](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/bigqueryml-syntax-ai-similarity):
  compute the semantic similarity between pairs of text, pairs of images, or
  across text and images. This function is in
  [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages).
* You can use the
  [`AI.GENERATE_BOOL`](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/bigqueryml-syntax-ai-generate-bool),
  [`AI.GENERATE_DOUBLE`](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/bigqueryml-syntax-ai-generate-double),
  and
  [`AI.GENERATE_INT`](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/bigqueryml-syntax-ai-generate-int)
  functions to generate scalar values, which are convenient for filtering,
  scoring, and counting purposes.
* Each of these functions supports
  [authentication with end-user credentials (EUC)](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/permissions-for-ai-functions#run_generative_ai_queries_with_end-user_credentials)
  to set up the necessary Vertex AI permissions.

BigQuery ML now supports the following table-valued generative AI functions:

* [`AI.GENERATE_TABLE`](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/bigqueryml-syntax-generate-table):
  generate a table of structured output from unstructured data including
  text, images, audio, and video.
* [`AI.GENERATE_TEXT`](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/bigqueryml-syntax-ai-generate-text)
  is the new, preferred version of `ML.GENERATE_TEXT`, which has the same
  functionality but with simplified column output names.
* [`AI.GENERATE_EMBEDDING`](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/bigqueryml-syntax-ai-generate-embedding)
  is the new, preferred version of `ML.GENERATE_EMBEDDING`, which has the same
  functionality but with simplified column output names.
* These functions are all
  [generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages)
  (GA).

summary.title: New Generative AI Functions in BigQuery ML
summary.summary: BigQuery ML now offers a suite of powerful generative AI functions, including AI.GENERATE for text and structured output, AI.EMBED for creating embeddings from various data types, and AI.SIMILARITY for semantic comparisons. These enhancements allow for advanced natural language processing and data analysis directly within BigQuery, with support for end-user credentials for secure access. The update also introduces table-valued functions like AI.GENERATE_TABLE and preferred versions of text and embedding generation functions.

2025-11-18.content:
You can now use [Gemini 3.0](https://docs.cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/models/gemini/3-pro)
when you call generative AI functions in BigQuery,
such as [`AI.GENERATE`](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/bigqueryml-syntax-ai-generate).
You must use the full global endpoint argument:

`https://aiplatform.googleapis.com/v1/projects/PROJECT_ID/locations/global/publishers/google/models/gemini-3-pro-preview`.

summary.title: Gemini 3.0 in BigQuery
summary.summary: BigQuery now supports Gemini 3.0 for generative AI functions. Use the full global endpoint for integration.

2025-11-18.content:
You can now [publish data insights](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/data-insights#modes),
including query recommendations and
auto-generated table and column descriptions, to the Dataplex Universal Catalog.
This feature is in
[Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Data Insights Now Available in Dataplex Universal Catalog
summary.summary: You can now publish data insights, including query recommendations and auto-generated table and column descriptions, to the Dataplex Universal Catalog. This feature is currently in Preview.

2025-11-17.content:
In the query execution graph, you can now use the [query text
heatmap](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/query-plan-explanation#query_text_heatmap) to identify
which query text contributes to stages that consume more slot time, and to see
query plan details for those stages. This feature is in
[Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Query text heatmap for query execution graph
summary.summary: Identify query text contributing to slot time consumption using the new query text heatmap in the query execution graph. This feature, currently in Preview, allows you to view query plan details for time-consuming stages.

2025-11-17.content:
You can use [folders](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/code-asset-folders) to organize and control
access to single file code assets, such as notebooks, saved queries, data
canvases, and data preparation files. This feature is in
[Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Organize code assets with folders
summary.summary: Use folders to organize and control access to single file code assets like notebooks, saved queries, and more. This feature is currently in Preview.

2025-11-17.content:
You can now
[share SQL stored procedures in BigQuery sharing listings](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/analytics-hub-manage-listings#share-stored-procedure-in-listing)
and enable
[role-based authorization for stored procedures](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/authorized-routines#authorize_routines).
These features are in [preview](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Share SQL stored procedures in BigQuery
summary.summary: BigQuery now allows sharing SQL stored procedures and managing role-based authorization for them. These features are currently in preview.

2025-11-11.content:
The BigQuery [Overview page](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/bigquery-web-ui#open-overview)
is now your hub for discovering tutorials, features, and resources to help you
get the most out of BigQuery. It provides guided paths for users
of all skill levels. This feature is in
[Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: BigQuery Overview Page Now Available
summary.summary: The BigQuery Overview page is a new hub for tutorials, features, and resources, offering guided paths for all users. This feature is currently in Preview.

2025-11-11.content:
You can now use the
[interactive SQL translator](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/interactive-sql-translator), the
[translation API](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/api-sql-translator), and the
[batch SQL translator](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/batch-sql-translator) to translate the
following SQL dialects into GoogleSQL:

* Apache Impala SQL
* GoogleSQL (BigQuery)

Impala SQL translation can be used to migrate Cloudera and Apache Hadoop SQL
workloads that use Impala as a query engine.

GoogleSQL (BigQuery) translation can be used to verify and iteratively customize
your translated SQL queries after an initial translation from an external
dialect. For example, you can apply systematic query rewrites using [YAML
configurations](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/config-yaml-translation#optimize_and_improve_the_performance_of_translated_sql)
to customize and optimize your GoogleSQL queries before deploying it.

These features are in [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: SQL translator
summary.summary: Translate Impala SQL and GoogleSQL to GoogleSQL with new tools.

2025-11-11.content:
You can now use [custom constraints](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/custom-constraints) with an
Organization Policy to provide more granular control over specific fields for
BigQuery dataset resources. This feature is [generally available](https://docs.cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) (GA).

summary.title: Custom Constraints for BigQuery Datasets are Generally Available
summary.summary: You can now use custom constraints with Organization Policy for more granular control over BigQuery dataset resources. This feature is now generally available.

2025-11-10.content:
You can [aggregate](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/data-prep-get-suggestions#aggregate)
and [deduplicate](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/data-prep-get-suggestions#deduplicate)
table data with Gemini assistance in your
[BigQuery data preparations](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/data-prep-introduction).
These features are [generally available](https://docs.cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) (GA).

summary.title: Aggregate and Deduplicate Table Data
summary.summary: You can now aggregate and deduplicate your table data with Gemini assistance in BigQuery data preparations. These features are generally available.

2025-11-10.content:
BigQuery ML now offers the
[`AI.DETECT_ANOMALIES` function](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/bigqueryml-syntax-ai-detect-anomalies).
Use the `AI.DETECT_ANOMALIES` function with a TimesFM model to
[detect anomalies](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/anomaly-detection-overview)
in time series data, using historical data as a baseline.
This feature is in
[Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: AI.DETECT_ANOMALIES function
summary.summary: The AI.DETECT_ANOMALIES function is now available in BigQuery ML for detecting anomalies in time series data. It uses historical data as a baseline and is currently in Preview.

2025-11-10.content:
BigQuery ML now supports the `TimesFM 2.5`
[time series foundational model](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/timesfm-model).
You can use the `TimesFM 2.5` model in the
[`AI.FORECAST`](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/bigqueryml-syntax-ai-forecast),
[`AI.EVALUATE`](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/bigqueryml-syntax-ai-evaluate),
and
[`AI.DETECT_ANOMALIES`](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/bigqueryml-syntax-ai-detect-anomalies)
functions to achieve better forecasting accuracy and lower latency.

summary.title: BigQuery ML Now Supports TimesFM 2.5
summary.summary: BigQuery ML has integrated the TimesFM 2.5 foundational model, enhancing forecasting capabilities.

2025-11-10.content:
Partitioning is now available for
[BigLake tables for Apache Iceberg in BigQuery](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/iceberg-tables#use_partitioning).
This feature is in
[Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Partitioning for BigLake Tables
summary.summary: Partitioning is now available for BigLake tables for Apache Iceberg in BigQuery. This feature is currently in Preview.

2025-11-06.content:
The research paper [ARIMA\_PLUS: Large-scale, Accurate, Automatic and
Interpretable In-Database Time Series Forecasting and Anomaly Detection in
Google BigQuery](https://arxiv.org/abs/2510.24452) is now publicly available.
This paper describes the algorithms behind the
[`ARIMA_PLUS`](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/bigqueryml-syntax-create-time-series)
and
[`ARIMA_PLUS_XREG`](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/bigqueryml-syntax-create-multivariate-time-series)
models for time series forecasting and anomaly detection, and demonstrates the
high performance, scalability, explainability, and customizability of the
models.

summary.title: ARIMA Plus in BigQuery
summary.summary: A new research paper details ARIMA Plus, a novel system for time series forecasting and anomaly detection within Google BigQuery. The paper highlights its performance, scalability, and interpretability.

2025-11-05.content:
You can now generate [data insights](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/data-insights#rest) when you
create a
[`DataScan`](https://docs.cloud.google.com/dataplex/docs/reference/rest/v1/projects.locations.dataScans)
using the Dataplex API. This feature is
[generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages)
(GA).

summary.title: Data Insights Now Available
summary.summary: You can now generate data insights when you create a DataScan using the Dataplex API. This feature is generally available.

2025-11-05.content:
You can now
[generate table and column descriptions](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/data-insights#generate-column-table-descriptions)
in all supported Gemini languages when you generate data insights.
This feature is
[generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages)
(GA).

summary.title: New Feature: Generate Descriptions in All Supported Gemini Languages
summary.summary: You can now generate table and column descriptions in all supported Gemini languages when generating data insights. This feature is now generally available.

2025-11-05.content: The [BigQuery Data Transfer Service for Google Ads](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/google-ads-transfer) now supports [Google Ads API v21](https://developers.google.com/google-ads/api/fields/v21/overview).

summary.title: Google Ads API v21 Support
summary.summary: The BigQuery Data Transfer Service for Google Ads now supports Google Ads API v21.

2025-11-05.content:
You can use the
[`MATCH_RECOGNIZE` clause](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/query-syntax#match_recognize_clause)
in your SQL queries to filter and aggregate matches across rows in a table.
This feature is
[generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages)
(GA).

summary.title: MATCH_RECOGNIZE clause in SQL
summary.summary: The MATCH_RECOGNIZE clause is now generally available for use in SQL queries.

2025-11-04.content:
You can now use [custom organization policies with the BigQuery migration
service](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/migration-custom-org-policies) to allow or deny specific
operations during a BigQuery migration to meet your organization's compliance
and security requirements. This includes an option to disable AI suggestions
during a migration. This feature is in
[Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Custom organization policies for BigQuery migration now available
summary.summary: You can now use custom organization policies with the BigQuery migration service to allow or deny specific operations during a BigQuery migration. This feature, which is in Preview, helps meet your organization's compliance and security requirements and includes an option to disable AI suggestions during a migration.

summary.title: Pivot table row capacity doubled for Connected Sheets
summary.summary: The row capacity for BigQuery-backed pivot tables in Connected Sheets has been increased from 100,000 to 200,000 rows.

2025-10-30.content:
The
[Apache Iceberg REST catalog in BigLake metastore](https://docs.cloud.google.com/biglake/docs/blms-rest-catalog)
is now
[generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages)
(GA) with several new features, including BigQuery catalog federation,
credential vending, and catalog management in the Google Cloud console.

summary.title: Apache Iceberg REST catalog in BigLake metastore is now GA
summary.summary: The Apache Iceberg REST catalog in BigLake metastore has reached general availability. This feature now includes BigQuery catalog federation, credential vending, and catalog management directly within the Google Cloud console.

2025-10-29.content:
You can now [group
reservations](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reservations-tasks#prioritize_idle_slots_with_reservation_groups)
together to prioritize idle slot sharing within the group. Reservations within a
reservation group share idle slots with each other before making them available
to other reservations in the project, giving you more control over slot
allocation for high-priority workloads. This feature is in
[Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Reservation Groups for Prioritizing Workloads
summary.summary: You can now group reservations together to prioritize idle slot sharing within the group.

2025-10-28.content:
Subscriber email logging lets you log the principal identifiers of users
who execute jobs and queries against linked datasets. You can enable
logging at the
[listing level](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/analytics-hub-manage-listings#create_a_listing)
and the
[data exchange level](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/analytics-hub-manage-exchanges#create-exchange).
The logged data is available in the `job_principal_subject` field of the
[`INFORMATION_SCHEMA.SHARED_DATASET_USAGE` view](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/information-schema-shared-dataset-usage).
This feature is
[generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Subscriber email logging
summary.summary: New feature: subscriber email logging is now available. This allows you to log the principal identifiers of users who execute jobs and queries against linked datasets. You can enable this feature at the listing or data exchange level.

2025-10-28.content:
The BigQuery Data Transfer Service can now transfer data from the
following data sources:

* [Facebook Ads](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/facebook-ads-transfer)
* [Salesforce](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/salesforce-transfer)
* [Salesforce Marketing Cloud](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/sfmc-transfer)
* [ServiceNow](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/servicenow-transfer)

Transfers from these data sources are now [generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages)
(GA).

summary.title: New Data Sources Available in BigQuery Data Transfer Service
summary.summary: BigQuery Data Transfer Service now supports data transfers from Facebook Ads, Salesforce, Salesforce Marketing Cloud, and ServiceNow. These integrations are now generally available.

2025-10-27.content:
You can now [use the Data Engineering Agent](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/data-engineering-agent-pipelines)
to use Gemini in BigQuery to build and modify data
pipelines to ingest data into BigQuery. This feature is in
[preview](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Introducing the Data Engineering Agent
summary.summary: Use the new Data Engineering Agent with Gemini in BigQuery to build and modify data pipelines for ingesting data.

2025-10-27.content:
The administrative jobs explorer now includes a [job details
page](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/admin-jobs-explorer#get-job-details) to help you diagnose
and troubleshoot queries. The **Performance** tab compiles query information
including the execution graph, SQL text, execution history, performance
variance, and system load during execution. You can also [compare two
jobs](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/admin-jobs-explorer#compare-jobs) to identify discrepancies
and potential areas to improve query performance.

This feature is in [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: New Job Details Page for Query Troubleshooting
summary.summary: A new job details page is now available in the administrative jobs explorer to help diagnose and troubleshoot queries. It includes performance information, execution details, and the ability to compare jobs for performance improvement.

2025-10-27.content:
BigQuery now offers the following
[managed AI functions](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/generative-ai-overview#managed_ai_functions)
that use Gemini to help you filter, join, rank, and classify your data:

* [`AI.IF`](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/bigqueryml-syntax-ai-if):
  Filter and join text or multimodal data based on a condition described in natural language.
* [`AI.SCORE`](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/bigqueryml-syntax-ai-score):
  Rate text or multimodal input to rank your data by quality, similarity, or other criteria.
* [`AI.CLASSIFY`](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/bigqueryml-syntax-ai-classify):
  Classify text into user-defined categories.

These functions are in [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Introducing AI Functions in BigQuery
summary.summary: BigQuery now offers managed AI functions that leverage Gemini for data manipulation tasks like filtering, joining, ranking, and classification.

2025-10-27.content:
You can now use the Apache Arrow format to
[stream data to BigQuery with the Storage Write API](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/write-api#arrow-handling).
This feature is
[generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages)
(GA).

summary.title: Apache Arrow format support for BigQuery Storage Write API
summary.summary: You can now use the Apache Arrow format to stream data to BigQuery with the Storage Write API. This feature is now generally available.

2025-10-23.content:
BigQuery is now offering
[early access](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages)
to conversational analytics. Conversational analytics accelerates data analysis
by enabling quick insights through natural language. Users can chat with their
BigQuery data, create custom agents, and access those agents even outside of
BigQuery. To enroll in conversational analytics early access, fill out the
[request form](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSe5KhRr81uUce6mKj8YrV1iFezGIydTxOcx8wUTqcBJP3e7vg/viewform).

summary.title: Conversational Analytics in BigQuery
summary.summary: BigQuery introduces conversational analytics for faster data insights using natural language. Users can interact with data, build custom agents, and access them outside of BigQuery.

2025-10-22.content:
You can now use custom constraints with Organization Policy to provide more
granular control over specific fields for some BigQuery sharing
resources. For more information, see
[Manage Sharing data exchanges and listings using custom constraints](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/analytics-hub-custom-constraints).
This feature is in
[preview](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Granular control for BigQuery sharing
summary.summary: Organization Policy now supports custom constraints for more granular control over specific fields in BigQuery sharing resources. This feature is currently in preview.

2025-10-22.content:
Support for
[table parameters in table-value functions (TVFs)](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/table-functions#table_parameters)
has been temporarily disabled. We are working to restore this feature as soon
as possible.

summary.title: Table parameters in TVFs temporarily disabled
summary.summary: Support for table parameters in table-value functions (TVFs) has been temporarily disabled. We are working to restore this feature as soon as possible.

2025-10-22.content:
BigQuery ML now offers a built-in
[TimesFM univariate time series forecasting model](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/timesfm-model)
that implements Google Research's open source TimesFM model. You can use
BigQuery ML's built-in TimesFM model with the following functions:

* Use
  [`AI.FORECAST`](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/bigqueryml-syntax-ai-forecast)
  to perform forecasting. This function now supports a larger context window.
* Use
  [`AI.EVALUATE`](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/bigqueryml-syntax-ai-evaluate)
  to evaluate forecasted data against a reference time series based on
  historical data.

To try using a TimesFM model with the `AI.FORECAST` function, see
[Forecast a time series with a TimesFM univariate model](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/timesfm-time-series-forecasting-tutorial).

This feature is
[generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages)
(GA).

summary.title: TimesFM Univariate Time Series Forecasting Model
summary.summary: BigQuery ML now includes a built-in TimesFM model for univariate time series forecasting. This feature, which is now generally available, allows you to use the AI.FORECAST and AI.EVALUATE functions for more robust forecasting capabilities.

2025-10-21.content:
BigQuery now supports TransUnion for
[entity resolution](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/entity-resolution-setup).
This feature is
[generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages)
(GA).

summary.title: Entity Resolution support in BigQuery
summary.summary: BigQuery now supports TransUnion for entity resolution. This feature is generally available.

2025-10-20.content:
You can now use [visualization cells](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/create-notebooks#cells) to
automatically
[generate a visualization](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/visualize-data-colab)
of any DataFrame in your notebook.
You can customize the columns, chart type, aggregations, colors , labels, and
title.

This feature is in [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Visualization cells
summary.summary: Generate visualizations from DataFrames in your notebook.

2025-10-20.content:
In BigQuery ML, you can now fully manage open models as Vertex AI endpoints.
BigQuery-managed open models offer the following benefits:

* [Manage Vertex AI resource by using SQL queries](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/bigqueryml-syntax-create-remote-model-open#managed-resources)
* [Automatic or immediate open model undeployment](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/bigqueryml-syntax-create-remote-model-open#managed-model-undeployment)
  to save costs
* [Customize model deployment machine types](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/bigqueryml-syntax-create-remote-model-open#machine-type)
  or reserve open model resources by
  [using Compute Engine reservations](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/bigqueryml-syntax-create-remote-model-open#reservation-affinity)

This feature is in [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Manage open models in BigQuery ML
summary.summary: BigQuery ML now supports managing open models as Vertex AI endpoints, offering benefits like SQL-based resource management, cost-saving auto-undeployment, and customizable deployment options.

2025-10-16.content:
The following features are now [generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages) (GA) in BigQuery Studio:

* To streamline resource discovery and access, the [left Explorer
  pane](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/bigquery-web-ui#explorer_panel) has been reorganized
  into three sections: Explorer, Classic Explorer, and Git repository. You can
  still use the Classic Explorer, which provides the complete resources tree.
* In the Explorer pane, you can use the [search
  feature](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/bigquery-web-ui#explorer_pane) to find BigQuery
  resources in your organization. The results appear in a new tab in the
  details pane. You can use filters to narrow your search.
* You can access job histories by clicking [Job
  history](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/managing-jobs) in the Explorer pane. A new tab opens
  that displays a list of job histories. BigQuery Studio no longer has a
  bottom pane for job history.
* To reduce tab proliferation, clicking a resource opens it within the same
  tab. To open the resource in a separate tab, press `Ctrl` (or
  `Command` on macOS) and click the resource. To prevent the current
  tab from getting its content replaced, double-click the tab. The name
  changes from italicized to regular font. If you still
  lose your resource, you can click tab\_recent Recent tabs in the
  details pane to find the resource.
* You can use breadcrumbs to navigate through different tabs and
  resources in the details pane.
* In the Home tab, the [What's new section](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/bigquery-web-ui#welcome_tab)
  contains a list of new capabilities and changes to the BigQuery Studio.
* The notebook action bar is consolidated by default to give you more screen
  space for writing code.

summary.title: BigQuery Studio Enhancements Now Available
summary.summary: BigQuery Studio has been updated with several new features to improve usability and resource management. Key enhancements include a reorganized Explorer pane for streamlined resource discovery, a new search feature, consolidated job history access, and improved tab management for a cleaner workspace. These updates aim to enhance the overall user experience within BigQuery Studio.

2025-10-16.content:
You can now access repositories by clicking Repositories in the Explorer pane.
A new tab opens that displays a list of repositories. The Explorer pane no
longer has a bottom pane for repositories. When you open a workspace in a
repository, it opens in the Git repository pane in the left pane. These
features are available in BigQuery Studio in
[preview](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Repositories Accessible via Explorer Pane
summary.summary: Repositories can now be accessed by clicking 'Repositories' in the Explorer pane, opening a new tab with a list of repositories. The bottom pane for repositories has been removed from the Explorer pane. Workspaces within a repository now open in the Git repository pane in the left pane. These features are available in BigQuery Studio in preview.

2025-10-15.content:
You can
[visualize your geospatial query results](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/geospatial-visualize)
on an interactive map in BigQuery Studio. This feature is
[generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages)
(GA).

summary.title: Geospatial query results visualization
summary.summary: Visualize your geospatial query results on an interactive map in BigQuery Studio.

2025-10-15.content:
You can use the `dbt-bigquery` adapter to run Python code that's defined in
BigQuery DataFrames. For more information, see
[Use BigQuery DataFrames in dbt](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/dataframes-dbt).
This feature is
[generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages)
(GA).

summary.title: Run Python code in BigQuery using dbt
summary.summary: You can now use the dbt-bigquery adapter to execute Python code defined in BigQuery DataFrames. This feature is generally available.

2025-10-14.content:
You can now use [SQL cells](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/create-notebooks#cells) to write,
edit, and run SQL queries on your BigQuery data directly from your
notebooks. This feature is in
[Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: SQL cells in notebooks
summary.summary: You can now use SQL cells to write, edit, and run SQL queries on your BigQuery data directly from your notebooks. This feature is in Preview.

2025-10-14.content:
The BigQuery Data Transfer API (bigquerydatatransfer.googleapis.com) is now
enabled by default for every new Google Cloud project. This feature is
[generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages)
(GA).

summary.title: BigQuery Data Transfer API Now Enabled by Default
summary.summary: The BigQuery Data Transfer API is now generally available and enabled by default for all new Google Cloud projects.

2025-10-14.content:
You can now [embed natural language as comments in existing SQL to refine and
transform your code](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/write-sql-gemini#generate_sql_from_a_comment).
This feature is [preview](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Natural Language SQL Comments
summary.summary: Use natural language comments within your SQL code to refine and transform it. This new feature is currently in preview.

2025-10-09.content:
You can [allocate idle slots fairly](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/slots#fairness) across
reservations within a single admin project. This ensures each reservation
receives an approximately equal share of available capacity. This feature is now
[generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages)
(GA).

summary.title: Fairness in slot allocation
summary.summary: Idle slots can now be allocated fairly across reservations within a single admin project, ensuring each reservation gets an equal share of available capacity. This feature is now generally available.

2025-10-09.content:
You can set a [maximum slot
limit](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reservations-workload-management#predictable) for a
reservation. You can configure the maximum reservation size when creating or
updating a reservation. This feature is now [generally
available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) (GA).

summary.title: Maximum Slot Limit for Reservations Now GA
summary.summary: You can now set a maximum slot limit for reservations, configuring the maximum reservation size during creation or update. This feature is now generally available.

2025-10-09.content:
[Security, privacy, and compliance for Gemini in
BigQuery](https://docs.cloud.google.com/gemini/docs/bigquery/security-privacy-compliance) details how
customer data is protected and processed by Gemini in BigQuery.

summary.title: Security, privacy, and compliance for Gemini in BigQuery
summary.summary: Learn how customer data is protected and processed by Gemini in BigQuery.

2025-10-09.content: An updated version of the [ODBC driver for BigQuery](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/odbc-jdbc-drivers#odbc_release_3151022) is now available.

summary.title: ODBC driver for BigQuery updated
summary.summary: The latest version of the ODBC driver for BigQuery has been released.

2025-10-08.content:
The [default limit of `QueryUsagePerDay`](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/quotas#query_jobs) for
on-demand pricing has changed. The default limit of all new projects is now 200
TiB. For existing projects, the default limit has been set based on your
project's usage over the last 30 days. Projects that have [custom cost
controls](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/custom-quotas) configured or that use
[reservations](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reservations-workload-management) aren't affected.
If the new limit might affect your workload, create a [custom cost
control](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/custom-quotas) based on your workload needs.

summary.title: Daily Query Limit Increased
summary.summary: The default daily query limit for on-demand pricing has been raised to 200 TiB for new projects. Existing projects will have limits adjusted based on recent usage. This change does not affect projects with custom cost controls or reservations.

2025-10-08.content:
You can set [labels](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/labels-intro) on reservations. These labels
can be used to organize your reservations and for billing analysis. This feature
is [generally
available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) (GA).

summary.title: Reservation labels now available
summary.summary: You can now add labels to your reservations for better organization and billing analysis. This feature is generally available.

2025-10-08.content:
You can [specify which reservation a query uses at
runtime](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reservations-workload-management#flexible), and [set IAM
policies directly on
reservations](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reservations-workload-management#securable). This
provides more flexibility and fine-grained control over resource management.
This feature is [generally
available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) (GA).

summary.title: Runtime query-to-reservation mapping and reservation-level IAM policies
summary.summary: BigQuery now allows specifying which reservation a query uses at runtime and setting IAM policies directly on reservations. This offers greater flexibility and control over resource management. This feature is now generally available.

2025-10-07.content:
As of February 25, 2025, enhancements to the [workload management
autoscaler](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/slots-autoscaling-intro) that were announced on [July
31, 2024](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/release-notes#July_31_2024) have rolled out to all users.
These enhancements are [generally
available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) (GA).

summary.title: Workload Management Autoscaler Enhancements Now GA
summary.summary: The enhancements to the workload management autoscaler announced on July 31, 2024, are now generally available to all users as of February 25, 2025.

2025-10-06.content:
The [`INFORMATION_SCHEMA.SHARED_DATASET_USAGE` view](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/information-schema-shared-dataset-usage#schema)
now includes the following schema fields to support usage metrics for
external tables and routines:

* `shared_resource_id`: the ID of the queried resource
* `shared_resource_type`: the type of the queried resource
* `referenced_tables`: Contains `project_id`,
  `dataset_id`, `table_id`, and `processed_bytes`
  fields of the base table.

These fields are
[generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) (GA).

summary.title: New Usage Metrics for External Tables and Routines
summary.summary: The INFORMATION_SCHEMA.SHARED_DATASET_USAGE view now includes new schema fields (shared_resource_id, shared_resource_type, referenced_tables) to support usage metrics for external tables and routines. These fields are now generally available.

2025-10-06.content:
The BigQuery Data Transfer Service can now [transfer reporting data from Google Analytics 4](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/google-analytics-4-transfer)
into BigQuery. You can also include custom reports from
Google Analytics 4 in your data transfer. This feature is
[generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) (GA).

summary.title: Google Analytics 4 data now transferable to BigQuery
summary.summary: The BigQuery Data Transfer Service now supports transferring data from Google Analytics 4, including custom reports, into BigQuery. This feature is now generally available.

2025-10-06.content:
The BigQuery Data Transfer Service can now transfer data from the
following data sources:

* [PayPal](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/paypal-transfer)
* [Stripe](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/stripe-transfer)

Transfers from these data sources are supported in [preview](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: New data sources supported in BigQuery Data Transfer Service
summary.summary: The BigQuery Data Transfer Service now supports data transfers from PayPal and Stripe in preview.

2025-10-06.content:
You can now set the priority of BigQuery jobs initiated by
Dataform workflows to run queries as interactive jobs that start
running as quickly as possible or as batch jobs with lower priority. For more
information, see
[Create a pipeline schedule](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/schedule-pipelines#create-schedule)
and
[InvocationConfig](https://docs.cloud.google.com/dataform/reference/rest/v1/InvocationConfig).
This feature is
[generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages)
(GA).

summary.title: Dataform BigQuery job priorities
summary.summary: You can now control the priority of BigQuery jobs run by Dataform. Choose between interactive jobs for faster starts or batch jobs for lower priority. This generally available feature helps optimize your data processing workflows.

2025-10-06.content:
Starting March 17, 2026, the BigQuery Data Transfer Service will require the
`bigquery.datasets.setIamPolicy` and the `bigquery.datasets.getIamPolicy`
permissions on the target dataset to create or update a transfer configuration.
For more information, see [Changes to dataset-level access controls](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/dataset-access-control).

summary.title: BigQuery Access Control Update
summary.summary: Starting March 17, 2026, BigQuery Data Transfer Service will require new IAM permissions for transfers.

2025-10-02.content:
You can now use the [notebook gallery](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/notebooks-introduction#notebook_gallery)
in the BigQuery web UI as your central hub for discovering and using prebuilt notebook
templates. This feature is in [preview](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Notebook Gallery Now Available in BigQuery
summary.summary: Discover and use prebuilt notebook templates directly within the BigQuery web UI using the new Notebook Gallery, now in preview.

2025-10-01.content:
You can now apply
[SQL query generated in the Gemini Cloud Assist chat](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/write-sql-gemini#chat)
to the query open in your editor. This feature is in
[Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: SQL query from Gemini Cloud Assist now available in editor
summary.summary: You can now apply SQL queries generated in the Gemini Cloud Assist chat directly to your open query in the editor. This feature is currently in Preview.

2025-09-29.content:
To simplify access management for your Iceberg tables, you
can use [credential vending mode with the Apache Iceberg REST catalog](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/blms-rest-catalog) in BigLake metastore. Credential vending removes
the need for catalog users to have direct access to Cloud Storage buckets. This
feature is in [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Access Management for Iceberg Tables
summary.summary: Simplify access management for your Iceberg tables using credential vending mode with the Apache Iceberg REST catalog in BigLake metastore. This feature removes the need for catalog users to have direct access to Cloud Storage buckets.

2025-09-29.content:
You can now create BigQuery
[non-incremental materialized views over Spanner data](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/materialized-views-create#spanner)
to improve query performance by periodically caching results.
This feature is in [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: BigQuery Materialized Views over Spanner Data
summary.summary: Improve query performance with new BigQuery materialized views over Spanner data. This feature, now in Preview, periodically caches results for faster querying.

2025-09-29.content:
BigQuery data preparation supports unnesting arrays, which expands each
array element into its own row for easier analysis. For more information, see
[Unnest arrays](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/data-prep-get-suggestions#unnest-arrays).
This feature is [generally
available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) (GA).

summary.title: Unnest arrays in BigQuery data prep
summary.summary: BigQuery data preparation now supports unnesting arrays, turning each array element into its own row for simpler analysis. This feature is now generally available.

2025-09-29.content:
[History-based query optimizations](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/history-based-optimizations)
are now enabled by default. If history-based optimizations have been previously
disabled, you can [re-enable history-based optimizations](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/history-based-optimizations#enable-history-based-optimization)
for your project or organization.

summary.title: History-based query optimizations enabled
summary.summary: History-based query optimizations are now on by default. You can re-enable them if previously disabled.

2025-09-25.content:
The
[`ARRAY_FIRST`](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/array_functions#array_first),
[`ARRAY_LAST`](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/array_functions#array_last),
and
[`ARRAY_SLICE`](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/array_functions#array_slice)
GoogleSQL functions are now
[generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) (GA).

summary.title: New Array Functions Now Generally Available
summary.summary: The ARRAY_FIRST, ARRAY_LAST, and ARRAY_SLICE GoogleSQL functions have reached general availability. These functions provide enhanced capabilities for working with array data.

2025-09-25.content:
BigQuery [data
canvas](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/data-canvas#destination_node) now
supports destination table nodes. Destination table nodes let you persist query
results to a new or existing table. This feature is [generally
available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) (GA).

summary.title: BigQuery data canvas now supports destination tables
summary.summary: BigQuery data canvas now supports destination tables, allowing you to save query results to new or existing tables. This feature is now generally available.

2025-09-24.content:
BigQuery ML now supports
[visualization of model monitoring metrics](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/model-monitoring-overview#monitoring_visualization).
This feature lets you use charts and graphs to
[analyze model monitoring function output](https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/docs/model-monitoring/run-monitoring-job#analyze_monitoring_job_results).
You can use metric visualization with the
[`ML.VALIDATE_DATA_SKEW`](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/bigqueryml-syntax-validate-data-skew)
and
[`ML.VALIDATE_DATA_DRIFT`](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/bigqueryml-syntax-validate-data-drift)
functions. This feature is
[generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages)
(GA).

summary.title: Model monitoring visualization now available
summary.summary: BigQuery ML now supports visualization of model monitoring metrics, allowing you to analyze model monitoring function output using charts and graphs. This feature is generally available and can be used with the ML.VALIDATE_DATA_SKEW and ML.VALIDATE_DATA_DRIFT functions.

2025-09-24.content: For command-line users, BigQuery is now integrated with the Gemini CLI to provide an agentic CLI experience. Using the dedicated [Gemini CLI extensions for BigQuery](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/develop-with-gemini-cli), you can search, explore, analyze, and gain insights from your data by asking natural language questions, generating forecasts, and running contribution analysis directly from the command line. This feature is available in beta.

summary.title: BigQuery Now Integrates with Gemini CLI
summary.summary: BigQuery now offers an agentic CLI experience through integration with the Gemini CLI. This allows users to interact with their data using natural language commands for tasks like searching, analysis, and forecasting directly from the command line. This feature is currently in beta.

2025-09-22.content: You can now run federated queries against [PostgreSQL dialect databases in Spanner](https://cloud.google.com/spanner/docs/reference/postgresql/overview) using [BigQuery external datasets](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/spanner-external-datasets) with GoogleSQL; this includes [cross-region federated queries](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/spanner-federated-queries#cross_region_queries). This feature is [generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages) (GA).

summary.title: Federated queries for PostgreSQL in Spanner are now available
summary.summary: You can now run federated queries against PostgreSQL dialect databases in Spanner using BigQuery external datasets with GoogleSQL. This feature is generally available and supports cross-region queries.

2025-09-22.content:
### Python

#### [3.38.0](https://github.com/googleapis/python-bigquery/compare/v3.37.0...v3.38.0) (2025-09-15)

##### Features

* Add additional query stats ([#2270](https://github.com/googleapis/python-bigquery/issues/2270)) ([7b1b718](https://github.com/googleapis/python-bigquery/commit/7b1b718123afd80c0f68212946e4179bcd6db67f))

summary.title: Python BigQuery Client Library v3.38.0
summary.summary: The latest Python BigQuery client library (v3.38.0) now includes additional query statistics, enhancing data analysis capabilities.

2025-09-16.content: You can now [access snapshots of Apache Iceberg external tables](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/iceberg-external-tables#query_historical_data) that are retained in your Iceberg metadata by using the `FOR SYSTEM_TIME AS OF` clause. This feature is [generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) (GA).

summary.title: Access historical data of external tables
summary.summary: Query historical data of external tables using the `FOR SYSTEM_TIME AS OF` clause.

2025-09-16.content: You can use the [`JSON_KEYS` function](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/json_functions#json_keys) to extract unique JSON keys from a JSON expression, and you can specify a [mode](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/json_functions#JSONPath_mode) for some JSON functions that take a JSONPath to allow more flexibility in how the path matches the JSON structure. These features are [generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) (GA).

summary.title: JSON Functions Now Generally Available
summary.summary: BigQuery's JSON_KEYS function and JSONPath mode are now generally available, offering enhanced flexibility for extracting JSON data.

2025-09-16.content: [SQL code completion](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/write-sql-gemini) is now available for all BigQuery projects. To learn how to enable and activate Gemini in BigQuery features, see [Set up Gemini in BigQuery](https://cloud.google.com/gemini/docs/bigquery/set-up-gemini). This feature is available in [preview](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: SQL code completion is now available for all BigQuery projects.
summary.summary: SQL code completion is now available for all BigQuery projects. You can learn how to enable and activate Gemini in BigQuery features by visiting the Set up Gemini in BigQuery documentation. This feature is currently in preview.

2025-09-15.content: In the BigQuery Studio, in the Explorer pane, you can now [open saved queries in Connected Sheets](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/manage-saved-queries#open-saved-queries-in-sheets). This feature is [generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) (GA).

summary.title: Saved Queries Now Available in Connected Sheets
summary.summary: You can now open saved queries directly within Connected Sheets from BigQuery Studio's Explorer pane. This new feature is generally available.

2025-09-15.content:
You can now enable the [BigQuery advanced runtime](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/advanced-runtime) to improve query execution time and slot usage. This feature is [generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages) (GA).
Between September 15, 2025 and early 2026, the BigQuery advanced runtime will become the default runtime for all projects.

summary.title: BigQuery Advanced Runtime Now Generally Available
summary.summary: BigQuery's advanced runtime is now generally available, offering improved query execution time and slot usage. This feature will become the default for all projects between September 2025 and early 2026.

2025-09-15.content:
### Java

#### [2.55.0](https://github.com/googleapis/java-bigquery/compare/v2.54.2...v2.55.0) (2025-09-12)

##### Features

* **bigquery:** Add custom ExceptionHandler to BigQueryOptions ([#3937](https://github.com/googleapis/java-bigquery/issues/3937)) ([de0914d](https://github.com/googleapis/java-bigquery/commit/de0914ddbccf988294d50faf56a515e58ab3505d))

##### Dependencies

summary.title: Java library updates
summary.summary: The Java library has been updated with a new ExceptionHandler for BigQueryOptions.

2025-09-15.content:

##### Features

* Updates to fastpath query execution ([#2268](https://github.com/googleapis/python-bigquery/issues/2268)) ([ef2740a](https://github.com/googleapis/python-bigquery/commit/ef2740a158199633b5543a7b6eb19587580792cd))
